entry.title: Adele's 21 Best Quotes

link.Abstract: Happy birthday, 21! While we're sure all of Adele's shiny new Grammys and BRITs make for excellent presents, the best-selling artist of 2011 has something else to celebrate. As of now, 21 has been No. 1 on Billboard for 21 consecutive weeks. To celebrate, here are 21 of Adele's best quotes during the year of 21.

entry.title: Photos: 2012 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: If you want photos of Adele looking adorable, you've come to the right place. The 2012 BRIT Awards went down in London Feb. 21. The show airs in Canada on MuchMusic, Feb. 21 at 8 p.m. Check out some of the highlights, with these pics of Rihanna, Coldplay, Kylie Minogue, Florence and the Machine, Ed Sheeran and more.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech. The biggest pop star in the world -- we repeat, the biggest pop star in the world -- was interrupted while accepting the BRIT Award for album of the year.
Adele: "You're going to cut me off?"
Host, James Corden: "I'm so sorry."
Adele: "Can I just say, then, goodbye and I'll see you next time 'round, yeah?" (Flips her middle finger.)
link.title: Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech.

link.Abstract: The stars are across the pond celebrated music's big night at the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, 2012. Check out the fashion winners and losers, and vote for your favourite looks!

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca
link.title: As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evenin

entry.title: Photos: Drake Does Sundance

link.Abstract: Drake was several hours late for his Sundance Festival set Jan. 21, but the Take Care rapper had an excuse. A snowstorm. "I almost lost my life six times to get to this motherf*cker," he told the crowd. "My flight was delayed six hours." Well, OK then. Check out photos from his show.
link.title: [ more ]

entry.title: Photos: Kanye West, Soundgarden and More at Australia's Big Day Out

link.Abstract: Where's the beef? Australia, apparently. Kanye West's soundcheck at the Big Day Out festival was so loud it reportedly drowned out Soundgarden's set, leading Soundgarden's Chris Cornell to make one very public noise complaint. As he told the crowd: "Sounds like there’s children playing music there. Retarded children, retarded as in held back. There’s no other word for it."
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Madonna's 12th album will be called M.D.N.A. Get it? It's like "Madonna" without the vowels (and that extra letter "N"). Or is it? We've got some theories on what M.D.N.A. stands for.

entry.title: The 11 Best Photos From Watch the Throne's Final Show

link.Abstract: Jay-Z and Kanye West wrapped their Watch the Throne tour in Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18. For the final concert's closing number, they performed the single "N*ggas in Paris" 11 times. Crazy. In that spirit, here are 11 of the best photos from Vancouver. We invite you to spend approx. 40 minutes flipping through them to better re-live Watch the Throne's encore experience.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Kanye West, left, and Jay-Z, right, at Rogers Arena in Vancouver, Dec. 17, 2011.
link.title: Jay-Z and Kanye West

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal
